metadata.title: Internet of Things Education Kit
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Specify, design, and program modern connected electronic systems in response to the ever-growing number of connected devices

metadata.title: Introduction to the Internet of Things, Module 1
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Define the IoT concept, understand what led to its emergence, and overview recent technology advances that make the IoT paradigm possible. Also understand the key challenges that must be addressed in order to build IoT systems. Also,  explore the opportunities IoT brings in different application domains.

metadata.title: IoT System Architecture And Standards, Module 2
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Examine different architectures that are adopted for building IoT ecosystems and also look at IoT standardization efforts.

metadata.title: Introduction to Embedded Systems, Module 3
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Define and provide a high-level overview of embedded systems, discuss some representative example, as well as the functions, attributes, and constraints of embedded systems. The material then looks at embedded systems-specific software, and programming debugging techniques.

metadata.title: Hardware Platforms for IoT, Module 4
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Explore what a hardware platform is and what the design involves. Discuss the different types of memories that can be encountered in microcontrollers and study power saving techniques. Examine different types of sensors and finish with a discussion about analog-to-digital conversion.

metadata.title: The Arm Cortex-M4 Processor Architecture, Module 5
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Overview of the Arm architecture and processor families. Diving into the M4 subfamily that is the most comprehensive group of mobile (M-type) processors.

metadata.title: Interrupts and Low Power Features, Module 6
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Covers microcontroller interrupts and exceptions handling, often with a view to how these enable low power operation.

metadata.title: Introduction to the Mbed Platform, Module 7
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Overview of the Mbed Platform and Cortex Microcontroller Software Interface Standard (CMSIS) that enables rapid IoT development.

metadata.title: Getting Started Lab Exercise, Module 7, Lab 0
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: How to create a new Mbed project, import code example, compile, and execute applications for embedded devices.

metadata.title: IoT Connectivity Part 1, Module 8
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Introduces the Bluetooth technology and examines the low energy version of this wireless protocol. Understand BLE profiles and take a look at the most recent features introduced with the most recent revisions of the specification. Finally, introducing ZigBee - another connectivity option for low-power short-range communications.

metadata.title: IO and GPIO, Module 8, Lab 1
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Learn how to configure and use the General Purpose Input/Output (GPIO) capability of a development board, at the register level without the use of an Application Programming Interface (API).

metadata.title: IoT Connectivity Part 2, Module 9
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Look at alternate connectivity options relevant to IoT, focusing on wireless local area networking and low-power wide area networking technologies.

metadata.title: Basic Mobile App, Module 9, Lab 2
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Create and build a simple Hello World application for your Android device.

metadata.title: Bluetooth Low Energy Program, Module 9, Lab 3
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Learn how to program the DISCO-L475VG-IOT01A board, which has an on-board Bluetooth V4.1 module (SPBTLE-RF), and subsequently use a mobile device to connect to it via Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE).

metadata.title: The Cloud, Module 10
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Covers cloud computing concepts that are relevant to IoT, including virtualization, networking protocols that enable the communication between IoT devices and device management platforms, and big data processing aspects.

metadata.title: Android App Heartrate, Module 10, Lab 4
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Design and build an app to connect to a heart rate sensor, using Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE), and display the information on-screen

metadata.title: IoT Security, Module 11
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Covers security aspects relevant to IoT, including different types of attacks and technical solutions designed to mitigate these.

metadata.title: IoT Sensors, Module 11, Lab 5
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Covers security aspects relevant to IoT, including different types of attacks and technical solutions designed to mitigate these.

metadata.title: IoT Sensor and App, Module 11, Lab 6
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Program the DISCO-L475VG-IOT01A board to operate as a weather station. This builds on previous labs where we learned how to send BLE advertisements, read from different sensors (including temperature), and connect to an embedded device via an app that we developed.

metadata.title: Current and Future IoT Trends, Module 12
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Discusses current and future trends in IoT, machine learning, and edge computing aspects that fuel the IoT growth.

metadata.title: WiFi Lab, Module 12, Lab 7
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Learn how to program the DISCO-L475VG-IOT01A board that has an on-board WiFi module to send and receive sensor data from the device management platform.

metadata.title: Activity Recognition - Final Project, Module 13, Lab 8
subject: arm
embedded
cortex-m
internet-of-things
cloud-computing
iot-security
disco-l475vg
creator: Paul Patras
Mark Allen
metadata.description: Design a full-stack Internet of Things (IoT) system for real-time classification of user activities. You will use an IoT board with accelerometer and gyroscope sensors, a cloud platform where you can instantiate a virtual machine (e.g., Google Cloud Platform), and an Android mobile phone.
